Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful staff - a gem”
Reviews.Author: Julie8322
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night unfortunately(wish it was more). It was a quick trip with our family while staying in London for the week. The staff was incredibly helpful with any of our needs. This hotel is around the corner from the Four Seasons and is half the price. The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms modern and good size. Our balcony was great to get fresh air and take in the view. The restaurant was yummy (great breakfast). Overall such a great stay with the room size, style, beautiful bathrooms and the best location (good value). And, best of all - staff were wonderful. Thanks for accommodating our family of 5!

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kimhunter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days before my husband arrived to stay after the Tour de France. I was made to feel very welcome and comfortable by all the staff. The staff were amazing! Lost my luggage coming from Australia for 2 days and the staff were very helpful it assisting me to chase it up with the airlines. They were more than willing to assist my husband with storing his bike until it was picked up for the transport company. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were spacious, clean, bright, comfortable and very modern. The bathroom was huge! the balcony was lovely to open for fresh air and also have a view of the tower. Location was great for shopping, especially for men. The lounge and dining are gorgeous! I WILL STAY HERE AGAIN AND AGAIN. JUST PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Claudia R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed for a long weekend at the Hotel de Sers. The location could not have been any better - within minutes you can walk to the Champs Elysees, the Eiffel Tower, the shops of Avenue Montaigne, and a longer, but lovely walk to the Louvre. It is practically next door to the Georges V (4 Seasons), but is 1/2 of the price for a room. The entire staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, with making and changing restaurant reservations and making us feel at home. We had a lovely Junior Suite with 2 bathrooms. Probably one of the best recommendations I can give is the honesty and trustworthiness of the staff. When I thought I had lost a very valuable diamond earring in our room, the people at the front desk, and most importantly, the housekeepers, could not have been more helpful - they spent an hour scouring our room - lifting the mattress and box springs and looking everywhere, even in trash cans. They promised me (and I had full faith and trust) that if it turned up after we checked out that day, that they would make sure it was sent to me back home in the States. The hotel even followed up with an email to us after we had left, to tell us that they had continued to look, but unfortunately still hadn't found it. I happily found the earring when I got home and unpacked, but I truly felt confident that had it turned up in the room, it would have been returned to me. Between the awesome location, the wonderful people and the lovely room, my husband and I would highly recommend the Hotel de Sers for a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Near Enough Isn't Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeIlko
Reviews.Content: Le Hotel De Sers is in a good location and is in good condition and provides good service. And that's the problem, its good - but it isn't great. Le Hotel De Sers is simply too expensive to be good. The standard room rate for our room (a deluxe room) was 695 EUROS per night yet we could have stayed at Claridges or The Four Seasons with change for a good meal for the same money. Yet Le Hotel De Sers isn't anywhere near the standard set at either of those establishments. Don't get me wrong, it was a very pleasant stay, with very pleasant staff in a very pleasant hotel but it just felt soulless and bland. For example, there wasn't a pool to relax in or any kind of quirkiness or anything with a remotely unique characteristic - just a wholly unremarkable stay. It felt like a driving a BMW, as opposed to an Alfa Romeo, or like listening to an X Factor winning single as opposed to Jimmi Hendrix. I have already forgotten what the hotel reception looked like yet we arrived home just yesterday. Our whole stay was like watching a movie with expensive production values but no story to tell and the whole experience has left me mildly annoyed that we could have stayed somewhere special for the same money. It's simply bad value and you'd be much better off staying at the Four Seasons next door (which has all the things Le Hotel De Sers doesn't) for slightly less money (e.g. a good restaurant, a pool, and an atmosphere).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Enjoyable in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business recently and was impressed with the quality and general standards within the hotel. Directly on the next corner from the grand George V four seasons... But without the price tag. It is understood some famous personality was in this hotel whilst staying there, he... I know but won't say who it was.. Probably comes here to get away from the screaming crowds! So...description, reception behind a curtain....how daft..on the left..it feels narrow as you walk in, it goes back quite a way, with a decent lounge area in the centre, the restaurant and bar area is at he rear, I had breakfast in the hotel... In short..fussy and expensive for what you got, so if you want the glam but keep a few more quid, grab a breakfast across the road. Rooms decent, I had a front double room, huge bed, usual in room nice touches, enough lighting options to throw a lighting technician, lovely bathroom, great shower. All in all lovely place, maybe a tad too much...after all it is only Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel Located at the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Marwan A
Reviews.Content: This was our first boutique hotel to stay in and we were very worried whether or not it will turn out to be good. This hotel is just next door to the Four Sean's George V which is also a 5 min walk from the George V metro station. The hotel offers spacious rooms with excellent service. Our package included continental breakfast which was just delicious. The concierge of the hotel is very helpful and truly 5 star. The most amazing thing about the hotel, among other things, is the terrace of the room which not only gives you a nice view but also a nice sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little piece of romance; a hidden little gem in the heart of true Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Littlekt2
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to this hotel for Christmas. We drove, due to my being heavily Pregnant (which was no mean feat from Manchester) but the greeting we received on arrival helped blow the cobwebs (and the onset of a heart attack after negotiating the infamous roundabout where the arc de triumphe resides) away. I particularly received specialist treatment, having my car door opened and assisted from the car even before my enormous bump was noticed. The staff were all more than polite and courteous and clearly take pride in the service they provide. The rooms felt spacious and comfortable, with a fabulous bathroom. Having stayed in many centrally located, city hotels, we were amazed at the complete lack of outside noise - a real bonus! We enjoyed a drink at the bar before heading off into the night to soak up the atmosphere. The restaurant we had been recommended was also lovely. Above all, a great experience and one we would definitely repeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing moments”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: I have book the Hotel De Sers for our wedding anniversary A great welcome from Benoit at the reception desk , you had a great room in fact it was a junior suite ; as it was a special occasion the general manager have send us a bottle of champagne with chocolat of Fauchon "whaoo so parisian" we did try the restaurant but we have spend a nice moment at the Bar , we have try a cocktail made by Esteban so so nice . the location of the hotel is amazing just off the champs elysees avenue and walking distance from the beautifull Eiffel Tower . For honeymoon or wedding anniversary it's a perfect place , thanks a lot for making this moment amazing for me and my wife

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel more and more each day”
Reviews.Author: kakaface
Reviews.Content: Once we got over the sticker shock for what is essentially a solid three and a half star hotel, we grew to really love the place. Location is superb; staff really friendly and accommodating; bed very comfortable; and a charming courtyard cafe for any meal or cocktail were all the cat's meow. We would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star Paris boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Horatiolh
Reviews.Content: Kitsch Paris boutique hotel in excellent location around the corner from the Hotel George V. Good service, room and bathroom good size. The design is a little dated Miami Beach, Don Johnson style, but with old framed 19th. century portraits in the entrance and bar. Also, we were on first floor (second floor in USA) and then had to walk up another set of stairs to get to our room. Had a unscheduled wake up call at 8AM from the local hotel construction crew directly upstairs banging and drilling away. Strangely enough hotel said that they did not know anything about it..whatever. The best way to summarize this hotel is by its bathroom products, if you like pink bath gel that smells of cherry and purple soap that smells of something purple, you will love this property..otherwise, you might just like it as we did.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel you can find in Paris: great location, beautiful rooms and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: CarlosD77
Reviews.Content: It's my third time at the Hotel de Sers it's my home away from home in Paris. The whole experience it's becoming more and more special. The WOW factor it's something permanent in the Hotel de Sers. From the moment you enter in when you discover the beautiful yet intimate lobby with this beautiful fusion of classicism and and new decor. The warm welcoming at the Reception and great recommendations from the Concierge. The rooms are spacious, luminous and perfectly decorated. The bathroon OMG!!! Huge Amazing: beautiful bathtub, spacious walk in shower, two sinks and very luminous. The ameneties where just delicious and brought us a first Parisien Gourmand experience with the excellent macarrons, the impressive fruit platers with all the forest berries you could imagine and of course: Champagne, that we drunk with a very romantic view of Paris... If you are planning to go to Paris and you are looking for a very special small 5 star hotel, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: the-shmi
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after my friend was unhappy with our hotel in St. Germaine. Hotel de Sers was great - the room was a good size, the bathroom was very large, the location was great, and the service was extremely friendly. We had a really good experience there. No complaints! Room service was excellent for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Just splendid”
Reviews.Author: GManners
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel this is, I booked with my partner a romantic weekend in Paris, ending up chosing for this hotel, considering it is situatied in on the the most prominent parts of Paris. I hadn't realised it's also just a minute off the Champs-Elysees. Stunning mix of an old Parisian building and stupendous paintings, mixed with contempory furnishings and art work. Enjoyed the food on the open air court, and loved the fact that the bathroom had a stunning free standing bath. But if I must single out one compliment, then I need to congratulate the management on motivating the staff to such an extent that everyone is simply friendly and helpful. What a fabulous weekend, simply brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cebe_24
Reviews.Content: The location was great, staff was helpful, rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious and a cool ambience. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and go back in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Not absolutely a 5* plush hotel”
Reviews.Author: STARATHENS
Reviews.Content: Not a really 5* luxuries services or atmosphere. Although we've booked 2 rooms for 5 nights (27/4-2/5/2011), since 21st of January, they gave us backside no view rooms [1st of them (No 66) without a balcony and the 2nd one (No 67) as a long corridor], that they proudly called 'Superiors Double'. There wasn't possibility to change the room temperature (+ or -), bathroom without a curtain, not even a coffee / tea maker or a welcome small bottle of water. Overpriced soft drinks and water from the fridge (7-8 Euros the smallest one !). Nevertheless, when we asked for a hot camomile, that they brought immediately, they didn't charge us, although it cost 8 Euros !! Try ''PAUL'' in 78-80 Champs Elysees Av. (3 Euros for a grand coffee and 4,50 for a real French banquette sandwich). Excellent reception staff, perfect cleanliness and 3-4 minutes walking from Champs Elysees Av. and ''George V'' metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarlosD77
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to discover the Hotel de Sers 3 years ago I can say it's one the best hotels I know. Everything is perfect: the cozy and sophisticated atmosphere, the professional and attentive staff, the incredible location, the beautiful rooms and delightful details from the very first moment you enter it. I definately recommended and hope to visit it soon! Thanks...!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't do enough for us...”
Reviews.Author: Kate1315
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel as we were running the Paris Marathon. Before we went I contacted them to see if I could book massages for after the run - they couldn't have been more helpful - particularly Joffray. When we arrived, we were greeted like friends and so well looked after. Our order of porridge and bananas did not phase them at breakfast and was presented beautifully ! The location is fantastic - just off the Champs Elysee but what I liked most was the friendliness of the place in such a central location - something you wouldn't get in a large branded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great design but don't expect luxury or top-notch service.”
Reviews.Author: Frescocat
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I had stayed at the Hotel du Sers for business purposes. The design and ambience of this boutique hotel is great. It does indeed feel 'boutique like' and you may come across a few famous faces dining or drinking in the bar. However did not expect luxury or top notch service. The first time was fine - very small room but no service issues. However the second time (a year later) will be my last! For the price of the rooms (approx 400 euro for a bog standard room) I would expect them to excel in customer service and everything within the rooms to be working well. Myself and five other colleagues experienced water temperature problems both mornings when showering. Mine was scolding hot and theirs freezing cold. This was not resolved.There was also no curtain in my bathroom window meaning I was in full view of the apartments/offices opposite (I had to pee in the dark!). Breakfast was a farce with one sole waiter run off his feet in the restaurant, resulting in long waits and wrong orders. He seemed to also be taking room service bookings whilst serving us, carrying around a portable phone. I ordered breakfast in my room the second day. However when it arrived (late) I was told the omelette I had ordered was not available as the chef didn't start work until 8am (it was 7. 30am and no one had warned me). Instead I was given a basket of fat laden croissants and breads (something I had been trying to avoid on doctors' orders - hence the omelette order). No apology. I am in Paris practically weekly for business purposes and I get much better service paying 150 euro less elsewhere (for a luxury hotel). I work for a very large multinational and after this visit my colleagues and I ensured that this hotel was struck off our supplier list.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will stay...”
Reviews.Author: Grahamsound
Reviews.Content: When in Paris I don't stay anywhere else. The cheesecake alone is enough to make you want to return, the service and the staff are second to none. Definitely a personal service on a professional level!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights in hotel de Sers in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Johan1367
Reviews.Content: It's clear why they let guests pay in advance when checking in. The airco in our room wasn't working so we had to sleep in 26°C at night. Opposite of the hotel is a famous and well crowded nightclub where noisy people are standing and smoking outside. Keeps you well awake at night. No compensation was offered by the hotel when checking out...not even our water in the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Far from a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: btbmontclair
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels around the world, and this one doesnt come close. At best this is a 3 star in a 5 star location. For two nights in a row, housekeeping missed our room on turn down service. The pillows on the beds are tiny and hard. Mattresses are thin and hard. Fitness room has one treadmill, one piece of equipment, and was the temperature of a sauna. Room service dishes were left in the hallway the entire day. Our room overlooked the hotel restaurant with loud music and conversation and when we told the front desk that it was too loud to sleep they said it was the quietest room in the hotel. The concierge couldn't get a reservation at our requested restaurant and failed to tell us or suggest an alternative until it was too late.  All in all, this is not a hotel I could recommmend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver731229
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Paris for four years and have stayed in many hotels in Paris over the last 10 years. My recent experience at Hotel de Sers was the best I ever had in Paris. Rooms were nicely decorated and very unique. I really appreciated the decoration of the room. Rooms were certainly large enough and the bath room was just perfect. The location can't be much better. The hotel is situated close to the Champs Elysees but has the advantage of being in a smaller street which allows you a better night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the High Rent District”
Reviews.Author: Neptune170
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Hotel de Sers and absolutely loved it. The hotel is in the high-rent district, around the corner from the Four Seasons. But the price was very reasonable. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. Not overly-large by U.S. standards, but certainly roomy enough. The bathroom was excellent, with a tub big enough for the two of us, and a separate shower. And it was extremely quiet. We never heard any street noise, barely heard the staff and almost never saw or heard another guest. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We arrived early in the a.m., and they were able to have a room ready for us by 10:30, which was wonderful because we were exhausted from an overnight flight. Throughout our stay, they did everything we asked and more. They could not have been more accomodating. And the room had real air conditioning. Not the dribble of semi-cool air you find in some "air-conditioned" hotels in Paris. We set the thermostat on 68 at night and slept wonderfully. The only negative - and a small one - was that it is not terribly close to most attractions or, more importantly, the metro stations. The metro is several blocks away in either direction. Fine if the weather is good, but one day we had to walk 5 blocks in the rain from the metro to the hotel. And do not eat at any restaurant in the neighborhood. We paid $80 for a salad, a club sandwich and two beers each at one of the local restaurants. As I said, it's in the high-rent district. That said, I absolutely loved this hotel and will stay there again if I am lucky enough to return to Paris. I recommend it without reservation (no pun intended).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - lovely hotel though not 'French' in style...”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in December 2009 for a company kick off event. the hotel is very well positioned just around the corner from the George V. The hotel is very welcoming, plush, rooms very well laid out - roomy - full of all the mod cons and bathroom really good. The biggest let down was the price charged for a breakfast - around €40 which was really over the top - so be careful here, and in all honestly nip out and get a proper French breakfast and coffee for €15 or less around the corner! The hotel provided everything needed and Paris is such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking”
Reviews.Author: docswimmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel applies overbooking. I booked a 5 nights stay on their website 2 months before my trip to Paris. However, on arrival I was forced to another hotel. Excuse: a group had decided to stay longer. The other hotel (West End, same quarter) certainly was a good hotel, but did not offer the same package of client services: payed Wifi, no restaurant, limited breakfast possibilities, limited room service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: EssexJoEssex
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I have stayed at this hotel. The last time being 2 years ago. It's in a great location, just a few minutes from the Champs-Elysees. Another review mentions the noise from the bar next door keeping them awake until the early hours, but I can't even imagine what they mean as they are not any bars that close by. There are lots of restaurants in the surrounding streets, but on both visits I have found the hotel to be very quiet. Our room was on the 6th floor, with a small balcony overlooking the back of the hotel. Nothing exciting to look at, but nice anyway. The room isn't large, but it is very clean with nice facilities, and very modern. My only problem was with the bathroom. It's lovely - all marble, but the clear window (not opaque) only had a thin piece of net covering it. The window was also over the bath/shower. So fine during the day, but when you have the light on at night the entire room is illuminated. Not exactly what I want whilst in the shower, or even on the loo!! It's all apartments at the back of the hotel, so it was very odd! The drinks in the hotel are very expensive - around £20.00 for a vodka and coke - it was a large measure though! Although, in my experience all 5 star hotels are expensive for drinks. We didn't eat in the hotel, but found all the staff to be friendly/helpful. So all in all it's a nice place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, But Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaGail
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for major attractions around the immediate Paris district, shopping, Eiffel Tower, Arch di Triomphe, Restaurants (staff recommendations were awesome). On the downside, the rooms are small, but a great bathroom, caution, tub, be very careful not to slip in it, no safety handles. Lighting in room lacked. Bar across the street will keep you awake 5 out of 7 nights, all hours until 7:30ish in the morning. We found the bed to be very uncomfortable. Service in restaurant was sometimes good and at times a struggle. Definitely overpriced for what you get. Front Desk staff were very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. The excise room lacked in equipment. Would we recommend it? Strongly recommend to shop around first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Smith02
Reviews.Content: I worked in Paris for a time and had walked past Hotel de Sers on many occasions, but had never actually gone in or stayed there. So when the opportunity came to travel to Paris with my mum and a friend I decided to book, as it was one of the few hotels to offer a triple room. When we arrived we found we had been upgraded to a junior suite which was beautiful. Sers is a great example of a modern boutique hotel and the service was friendly and efficient. Our suite was very well equipped with everything we could possibly need, in particular the bathroom was fantastic. The location is perfect for all the main sights - eiffel tower, arc de triomphe and champs elysees are all a short walk away, as is the river. In short a perfect location for a weekend sightseeing in Paris. Although I didn't get a chance to see it, I gather this hotel also has suites with roof terraces with a view of the eiffel tower and with standards this good they may well be worth a visit next time.

Reviews.Title: “A 5-Star Hotel in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: tvljr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and leisure and found it met all my needs. The room was spacious for a European hotel with a large bathroom and small balcony overlooking the open air section of the hotel restaurant. The restaurant food was excellent and certainly equal to most Parisian restaurants. I found breakfast particularly good. The front desk was attentive, check in and out was rapid and recommendations on restaurants for dinner from the concierge were perfect every time. I highly recommend the hotel and would certainly come back. Only downside would be the restaurant is very expensive, but pretty much equal to other restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The hotel is within walking distance of the Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay again”
Reviews.Author: nfard11
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet hotel with excellent location and nice/polite staff. My husband and I enjoyed our stay. If you can afford it get the panaroma suite with balcony. We gave it a visit. It was very nice!! But is $2000/night. We stayed in a regular room. The room was large and quiet and clean with a comfortable bed. Nice and helpful staff too with a great location. continental breakfast included french pastries and breads with butter and jam, coffee or tea and orange juice. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So promising but horribly let down”
Reviews.Author: Noo36
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fabulous location and is hard to beat. It is very modern and decor wise a breath of fresh air in Paris. The room was a decent size, well decorated, comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. We did not eat in the restaurant but had room service breakfast which was good. But our experience was not a good one. We were away for our wedding anniversary and left a bag of presents and cards next to the bed when we went out. When we returned it was gone. We asked the hotel to investigate and were told that housekeeping had thrown it away because it was rubbish (we were assured that the cleaner had checked the contents of the bag before disposing of it and was sure it was rubbish - clearly not the case). If this was not bad enough, when I spoke to the Head of Housekeeping there was no apology - she was defensive and rude. We complained to the hotel manager about the incident itself and the attitude of staff in dealing with it, We did eventually receive an apology in response, as well as a scented candle and a teddy bear from the hotel merchandise as a parting gift. We did not however see our belongings again. The upshot? This hotel looks upmarket and swish - but when there was a problem we felt as if we were in a low rate, badly run B&B. The true quality of an establishment is always shown in how they handle a problem. This place was very badly lacking. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Love this little gem in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: celsius
Reviews.Content: This was the second time myself and my husband have stayed at Hotel de Sers. The hotel is like a home, small and intimate but with the added bonus of having very attentive, helpful staff. The location is fantastic - a 2 minute walk to the Champs Elysees and 5 mins in the other direction to the Eiffel Tower. There are some great restaurants and cafes around - one of our favourites is Le Victoria, located in Avenue Victoria, which has a great vibe at lunchtime and great food and wine. Also try Le Relais de l'Entrecote - this restaurant doesn't have a menu and only serves steak. It's really buzzy and fun and highly recommended. Back to the hotel - the rooms are pristine, if a little small. The bathrooms are wondeful - we had a huge free standing bath on our most recent visit, and the hotel smells like a bouquet of fresh flowers. If you're visiting Paris and want somewhere cosy, friendly, luxurious and within easy reach of great restaurants, bars and tourist attractions if you want them, then stay at Hotel de Sers. PS - you must also take a visit to Montmarte

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigladgriffy
Reviews.Content: an excellent hotel. i booked directly with the hotel and had arranged an upgrade to a superior room as it was my wifes bitrthday. the rooms however are cheaper if you book online rather than contacting them directly but they offered to throw a couple of extras in as it was a special occasion that was only available if i booked directly with the hotel. the bar was empty but plenty near by. breakfast was good and the concierge very helpful. an excellent location for sights, eating and shopping. we booked a courtyard side room and had no problem with any noise. room was spacios and well decorated, however they did forget to collect my brekfast order to be delivered to the room one day but after a phone call it was brought up very quickly and of course no charge!

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: awilson21
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is fantastic, off Avenue George V and just around the corner from the Four Seasons. The Alma Marceau metro stop was a 5 minute walk away. The staff that we encountered were very pleasant, polite and helpful. The room, by Paris standard, was massive. It was lovely with a very sexy, if a tad impractical, walk in shower - as there are no doors on it, water went all over the bathroom and we nearly had a few accidents. Some really nice touches like the iPod dock. The only dissapointment for us was the bar - it was dead on a Friday night and hence had no atmoshere. Overall though, this was a really nicely designed and decorated hotel, very clean and with excellent staff. I would certianly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Nice rooms! Helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Liz75
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Sers was fabulous! The location was ideally located for tourists! It didn't matter which way you started walking once you left the hotel, you'd be sure to hit a major Paris landmark. The Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, etc were all right there. The Metro and RER stops were also a few minutes walk - making it easy to get to all other the other tourist sites. The rooms were a good size for Paris and comfortable. The bathroom was huge - as big as the room! Although the location of the hotel was close to a busy area, our room was quiet. Also, it is important to me to sleep in a very cold room and the air conditioning system was perfect. I also found the staff very helpful and welcoming. We arrived several hours before check-in time and we welcomed to our room without any fuss. Any of our requests (e.g.,scissors, toothpaste, ice, iron, power adapter etc) were taken care of immediately. The food/drinks in the hotel were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful boutique hotel by the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: joyceg
Reviews.Content: All Paris hotel rooms are small...even smaller than NY rooms. HAving said that, our room at Hotel de Sers was a decent size. We were upgraded to a junior suite that consisted of a large master bathroom with a shower, large tub (which was very soakable), very comfortable king bed, fluffy pillows. We also had 2 closets, a narrowish sitting room (I think the couch was a sleeper but we didn't use it) and a "guest" bathroom. It is so nice to be able to go into the sitting room when one wakes up early so as to not bother the other sleeper. Internet was free. They had a problem with it the first night but it worked fine the next days. Again, not unusual for Paris, the kleenix and toilet paper are not as soft as in the US, but not bad. Free internet and room for 2 people to walk at the same time in a hotel room in Paris is wonderful. But the staff is what really made this place outstanding. Being "foodies" we wanted some nice restaurant reservations. They helped me before we arrived to secure some reservations and then continually helped while we were there. They had some VERY competent people behind the front desk to help with anything and everything. They also had a young man who was learning and had a ways to go. But they never left him alone and the more senior people were always listening to his conversations and directing him. The hotel is also in a nice location right off George V. We're walkers and could easily get to many tourist locations. But the underground is also right near the hotel. In spite of being in a trendy area, a few blocks away seems to get one in a less hectic area with, what seemed to be, more local spots. Of course, it doesn't come without a price. This one is a keeper if you can afford it or get a deal

Reviews.Title: “Watch for sily prices”
Reviews.Author: wipeout75
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great stay at this hotel. These reviews are pretty much spot on - we did have a bit of a problem with noise from the nightclub right opposite the hotel but I guess that can’t be helped. Just be aware if you are sensitive to that sort of thing and ask for a room overlooking the courtyard. The thing that annoyed me more was the bar prices. I don’t mind paying top whack - I can justify to myself £15 for a glass of champagne in a hotel bar. But to be charged £10 for a cup of tea, only for the bill to be made up to £15 when I asked for milk is frankly just crazy. I refused of course to pay the milk fee. Great location though and lovely rooms & staff.

Reviews.Title: “De Sers: fashion hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peynet78
Reviews.Content: De Sers: fashion hotel My husband and me have been at hotel de Sers in March 2008 Hotel de Sers is a refined and fashionable hotel, in a very good location. It is a small and new hotel. The staff has been very kind with us. We booked a junior suite (at a very good rate). When we went into the room, there was some smell of paint. We told the staff and immediately they gave us another room, nicer that the first: it was a panoramic suite. It was fantastic; a large hall with sofa and a first bathroom. Further on there was a large bedroom with a nice bed and finally a second bathroom. This was enormous, very big, with a fantastic view outside on a large window, all marble and a very big shower. We had continental breakfast included in our rate (Parisian breakfast). Breakfast is served at the table (no buffet). Parisian breakfast is only sweet (coffee, orange juice, butter, bread and jam, croissants). The front desk staff were extremely helpful, suggesting restaurants for dinner near the hotel and most of them spoke excellent English and Italian. De Sers is a very Parisian hotel. We recommend this hotel and when back in Paris we will probably come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “quite stylish if your room is big enough to look around”
Reviews.Author: gettingaround
Reviews.Content: the hotel has quite a confusing front door but the staff were all nice, the room was clean and was probably quite stylish if there had been space to stand back and have a look. The food would be better if the basics were absolutely right rather than attempting a fashion statement with every dish. It's very Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Stylish, Classy and Homely”
Reviews.Author: holstrav
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Boutique hotel, right in the centre of Paris. Just of the Champs Eleysee, Hotel has been renovated into abright and airy space, inside the shell of a splendid old building. rooms are large, beds comfortable Bathrooms have everything you need. right next door to the Four Seasons George V, where we spent one night of our stay (a birthday treat- also fabulous). Would thoroughly reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: northerner48
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel - modern and well designed - with fantastic staff. Restaurant/bar service was professional yet friendly and we were made to feel welcome by all. Highly recommend the location - easy to walk to many places and good metro access with Georges V and Alma both only 5 mins walk. Would definitely recommend and plan to go back here

Reviews.Title: “a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: ohashem1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel me and my wife for five days in the hotel, which was recommended by friends. Rooms were nice, modern finish, the whole hotel is pretty modern design, the location is perfect, for going around paris, I would definetly stay there again. if you want to spice your getaway further, but you need to book in advance, book dinner at Plaze de attine, Alan Du cas ( excuse my spelling), great, great, great night to crown your getaway, but beware $$$$$. regards

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Loved it!! Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjverdl
Reviews.Content: I think that says it all!! Fabulous location - one block from the madness at the George X. Great location -- we loved it. Our room had a sunroom with a glassroof and a balcony that ran between the sunroom and the bathroom! Huge soaking tub, separate shower, 2 sinks, all marble, and on and on. Bed was fantastic. The air conditoning was fabulous -- we like it very cold -- and we were sooooo comfortable!! Nice size closet -- lots of drawers -- and wonderul entry and safe. Staff was friendly -- but we found that we had everything that we needed and had very little contact with the staff. Breakfast was not worth the price -- however, if you are late risers as we are it was handy for a day or 2. On other days head out to Lauderre which is just up the Champs Elysee a block or two. Loved this hotel because it felt like home! No need for constant staff interaction -- all needs were anticipapted and tended to. I can't wait to return. We traveled on this trip to Edinburgh and London -- and I must say -- I feel in LOVE with the hotel and Paris!! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “de Sers next to George V and friendly too”
Reviews.Author: bikinigirl
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was so friendly. The hotel price is far less than posted for the average, so find a deal. You should get the best rooms for $360 or less (rooms with large porch and sun room). The food is so-so, but the location is great. The bathrooms have no shower curtain and the drain stop is on the wall near the light switch, so ask them to explain room features. The service is attentive, though not always exactly what you ask for--be specific and patient until you feel they understand your needs. They will try to help you with your needs. If you want a taxi, walk to Four season's 20yrds away. The hotel staff really makes this boutique hotel. It is very quiet. Be sure to check this site for night life and the like. enjoy Paris with a friend...too lonely alone

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. However the room wasnt ready when i arrived so i had to wait in the lobby/lounge area for about an hour. The rooms were spacious, i loved their bathrooms. a large screen tv in the room and internet was available.. you have to ask them to send up a cable though (not wireless) Breakfast was included in our package, croissant and bread with jams and the option of yoghurt or fruit. I stayed there 4 of my friends for a bachelorette weekend and they had placed rose petals on our beds when we arrived. The bar downstairs was trendy and slightly pricey. the location was perfect just 5 minutes walk from the Champs-elyses. Very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Forget It - Book the La Tremoille Instead!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: honest1London
Reviews.Content: After many pain staking hours trying to find a 4 star property, we read the reviews on this site and booked thinking we had found a great place. How wrong we were! Blatant lying after given the wrong room type was the main of many issues from this establishment. Only when we gave them eveidence from the room itself did they actually move us to the corect catogory. (they put us in a "superiour" room not the "delux room" as we had paid for) It was an uphill battle for them to admit that they had made a mistake and finally we were told that we could move to another room the following day. Take note that the room was small, no plazma TV as expected as per the website, the wrong incorrect meal, the wrong wine supplied, all with exceptional price tags (even for Paris) with no way of opening the bottle via room service.When the compaint was made with all the above, they didn't appear to be too concerned, moved us to the correct room catergory but made out that they were doing us the favour! Extremely disappointing to say the least, we were totally frustrated by their actions. We travel frequently world wide and always book a minimum of 4 star. Never In all of our years of travel, have I had such an experience. We moved to the La Tremoille who were fantastic, Exceptional large room, lovely room with views, truly a 4- 5 star hotel and wish that we had booked with them in the first instance!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect break”
Reviews.Author: Traveller039
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to the Hotel de Sers for his 30th Birthday. We stayed in a deluxe room which was superb. Huge room (for Paris), every modern comfort, beautiful bathroom (with an enormous bath, perfect for soaking tired legs after a days sightseeing) very flashy TV (which hubby loved!), massive bed and a balcony with a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. We had continental breakfast included in our rate which was great but breakfast was very expensive if you haven't already got this in your package. Other services at the hotel are expensive too but if you want a wonderful place to stay, in a superb location with the wow factor, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “High Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: CWADE88
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Sers is located around the corner from George V and just a few blocks from the Champs Elysees. The staff spoke English and were attentive and helpful. We had a room that overlooked a beautiful courtyard. Nothing in the room was second rate. The bed was wonderful and the deep tub was perfect after a day of sighthseeing. My only complaint would be that the charge of 30 Euro for a continenal breakfast seems a little excessive but there are other choices around including a little wine and cheese market next door that opens at 8 am.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Sers
HotelInfo.Address: 41 avenue Pierre 1er de Serbie, 75008 Paris, France
